main event: A UFO report from April 1957 on Guam, Marianas describes a ground-visual observation of a phosphorous flare, indicated as possibly a balloon or aircraft, with a length of observation of 1-2 seconds.
interesting points: The report was sourced from the military and categorized as D Ground-Visual type object.
The conclusion suggests that the UFO object was likely a released phosphorous flare, possibly from an aircraft or balloon.
The report mentions a phone conversation between military personnel, including Colonel Stringfellow, Colonel Brennan, and Major Sizemore of the 1502nd Air Transport Wing, Hickam.
The sighting was reported by the crew of a MATS RVF flight, Trip #352/228, and includes a statement from the pilot, LCDR Roach, describing the observed incident at around 2:53 AM.
The sighting report was classified as a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) and was distributed to various military commands for further evaluation.
witnesses: Military personnel and crew of a MATS RVF flight
